channel.title: UID - Not a noob-question
channel.description:
So, I know that ARGA does its UID replacement hack, and I'd like some more in-depth info on how it does that other than: [quote="Iamadam on RSR"]Basically, we pop their value of the stack and push our own.[/quote] So, by pop the value, do you mean the value which is an Ljava/lang/String; "uid.dat" to where it saves or the actual UID value.
Halp plz id giv u rep if i coud but i cant go to moperscap.
So ya..., ...any answers?

item.title: UID - Not a noob-question
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Why didn’t you ask on rsr where one of of arga devs are more likely to read it lol?
Simple class :

public class SomeClass { publiv static void main(String[] args) { int num = 1; int num2 = 2; int num3 = 3; num = num2; } }
That classes bytecode :

iconst_1 istore_1 iconst_2 istore_2 iconst_3 istore_3 iload_2 istore_1 return

Now say instead we want ‘num’ to = ‘num3’ and not ‘num2’. Where it loads num2 onto the stack(iload_2) you pop it off and load num3 on instead.

iconst_1 istore_1 iconst_2 istore_2 iconst_3 istore_3 iload_2 pop iload_3 istore_1 return

Its the exact same context with uid. I don’t THINK i can get any simpler then that. If you don’t understand, go find a bytecode tut somewhere :D. / or reply.

Read full topic

@frank wrote:

yar, you are misreading the code, unless it is a new feature

item.title: UID - Not a noob-question
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:4, topic:123473”]I saw this topic later to, but I already replied this one
I know Iamadam does it a different way, but there are multiple ways to do it, like the way I did it or just replace uid.dat just before launch and restore it after launch.[/quote]

i may be giving jagex too much credit, but every time you delete your uid and generate a new one it sets a boolean, the reflection packet could pick this up and they could notice how your generating a new uid every time but not re-downloading the cache, it could look fishy. but as i stated i may be giving them too much credit.

Read full topic

gee, i dont know, isnt this the second time i have seen this thread?

anyway, when iamadam says they pop the real value and push their own, did it ever occur to you that he literally meant what he said?

Read full topic

item.title: UID - Not a noob-question
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Well if you look trough client, you will find this:

                              try
                                {
                                    File file1 = new File(file, "uid.dat");
                                    if(k1 == 1 && (!file1.exists() || file1.length() < 4L))
                                    {
                                        Random random = new Random();
                                        int k2;
                                        for(k2 = -1; k2 == -1; k2 = random.nextInt());
                                        DataOutputStream dataoutputstream = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(file1));
                                        dataoutputstream.writeInt(k2);
                                        dataoutputstream.close();
                                    }
                                    if(file1.exists())
                                    {
                                        DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(new FileInputStream(file1));
                                        flag = true;
                                        q = datainputstream.readInt() + 1;
                                        datainputstream.close();
                                    }
                                }
                                catch(Exception _ex) { }

If you want to hack uid, change q to the uid you want. You can easly generate uid just use:

Random random = new Random();
int uid;
while(uid == -1) uid = random.nextInt();
uid++;

The following information is not working atm, as the method exists but it won’t be called!
[s]You can overide getSignUID though

Found in client:

public int getSignUID()
{
    return q;
}

[/s]

Note: Code taken out client 446, normaly decompiled without use of deobs.

Read full topic
